intro: Corynostylis palustris, commonly known as the swamp corynostylis, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family, and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers. The plant typically grows in dense clusters, with narrow, grass-like leaves that help it thrive in waterlogged soils. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination by insects. Corynostylis palustris plays an important ecological role in maintaining the biodiversity of its wetland environment.
